implantes.description: Permanent and natural solution to replace lost teeth. Implants are artificial titanium roots that support dental crowns.

fixas.description: Bridges and crowns fixed cemented on natural teeth or implants, offering maximum stability and comfort.

processSection.title: The Implant Placement Process
processSection.subtitle: A well-planned treatment for exceptional results.

01.title: Initial Evaluation
01.description: Complete examination with x-rays and CT scan to evaluate bone structure.

02.title: Digital Planning
02.description: Creation of a personalized treatment plan with 3D technology.

03.title: Placement Surgery
03.description: Minimally invasive procedure for implant placement.

04.title: Healing Period
04.description: 3-6 months for complete osseointegration of the implant to the bone.

05.title: Crown Placement
05.description: Installation of the definitive crown, customized for your smile.

1.a: The procedure is performed with local anesthesia, being virtually painless. Post-operative involves mild discomfort controlled with medication.

2.q: How long does an implant last?
2.a: With proper care, an implant can last a lifetime. The success rate is over 95%.

3.q: Can I get implants if I have little bone?
3.a: Yes, there are bone grafting techniques and special implants for cases of bone resorption.

higiene.title: How to maintain good daily oral hygiene
higiene.description: Practical habits for healthier teeth and gums: brushing technique, flossing, mouthwash, diet and when to consult the dentist.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Need a personalized plan? We can evaluate your routine and recommend the best products and techniques.

higiene.lead: Small daily habits make a big difference. Here's a practical guide to keep teeth and gums healthy ‚Äî at home and between appointments.
higiene.keyTakeaway1: Brush 2√ó a day (2 min) + interdental cleaning
higiene.whyText1: Oral health goes beyond aesthetics. Gum disease and cavities can cause pain, tooth loss and are associated with systemic conditions like cardiovascular disease and diabetes.
higiene.whyText2: The good news? Prevention is simple with the right habits. Here's what really makes a difference.

step1.title: Morning and night: brush for 2 minutes
step1.text: Use fluoride toothpaste and soft-bristled brush. Cover all surfaces ‚Äî outer, inner and chewing.

step2.title: Interdental cleaning (1√ó a day)
step2.text: Use dental floss or interdental brushes. Ideally at night, before brushing.

step3.title: Optional: mouthwash
step3.text: Use only if recommended by your dentist. Does not replace brushing or interdental cleaning.

step4.title: Hydration and less sugar
step4.text: Drink water throughout the day. Avoid snacking between meals, especially sugary foods.

higiene.tech1: Hold brush at 45¬∞ to the gum line (where tooth meets gum).
higiene.tech2: Make short, gentle movements ‚Äî avoid brushing hard.
higiene.tech3: Brush outer, inner and chewing surfaces of all teeth.
higiene.tech4: Gently brush tongue (or use scraper) to reduce bacteria and improve breath.
higiene.flossSectionText: Cavities and gum problems often start between teeth. If floss is difficult, interdental brushes can be an excellent alternative ‚Äî ask your dentist for the ideal size.
higiene.flossHowTitle: How to use dental floss (in 3 steps)
higiene.flossHow1: Slide gently between teeth and form a "C" around the tooth.
higiene.flossHow2: Make up and down movements, cleaning both sides of the tooth.
higiene.flossHow3: Use a clean section of floss for each interdental space.

diet.good2: Prefer snacks with less sugar (nuts, cheese, yogurt).
diet.good3: Chew sugar-free gum after meals (if appropriate) to stimulate saliva.
diet.limit2: Sipping soft drinks/juices slowly for a long time (constant acid exposure).
diet.limit3: Tobacco (major risk for gum disease and stains).

higiene.warningSubtitle: If you notice any of these signs, consider scheduling an evaluation:

warning.1: Gum bleeding when brushing or flossing
warning.5: Pain when chewing or jaw discomfort

faq.q1: If gums bleed, should I stop using floss?
faq.a1: Generally, no. Bleeding is often a sign of inflammation. Use floss gently and consistently; if it persists for 1‚Äì2 weeks, schedule an evaluation.
faq.a2: Not always. It can help in specific situations (gingivitis, high cavity risk). The base is brushing + interdental cleaning.
faq.a3: For many people, yes ‚Äî improves consistency and plaque removal. Technique remains important.

finalCta.title: Want a personalized oral hygiene plan?
finalCta.text: We can evaluate gum health, cavity risk and recommend products and techniques tailored to you.

implantes.title: Dental implants: complete guide
implantes.description: Everything you need to know about dental implants, from the procedure to recovery. Complete guide on implantology.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want to recover your smile? Schedule a free evaluation to see if implants are right for you.

implantes.lead: Dental implants are the most modern and effective solution to replace lost teeth. They function as artificial roots that support crowns, bridges or prosthetics, providing natural and lasting results.

takeaways.title: Key Points
takeaways.two: Can last a lifetime with proper care

implantes.whatText: A dental implant is a small titanium screw that is surgically inserted into the jawbone or mandible. Titanium is a biocompatible material, which means the body accepts it and bone grows around it, creating a solid foundation for the new tooth.

abutment.title: Abutment
abutment.text: Connection piece between implant and crown

advantages.2: Durability - can last a lifetime with proper care
advantages.7: Improve self-esteem and quality of life

implantes.eligibilityText1: Most adults with good general health can receive dental implants. However, careful evaluation is needed to determine if you're a good candidate.
implantes.eligibilityText2: Factors that can affect eligibility include:

eligibility.1: Amount and quality of available bone
eligibility.2: General health and medical conditions (diabetes, osteoporosis)

phase1.title: Phase 1: Evaluation and planning
phase1.text: The dentist performs detailed clinical and radiographic exams, including 3D CT scan, to evaluate bone and plan ideal implant position.

phase2.title: Phase 2: Implant placement
phase2.text: Under local anesthesia, the implant is inserted into the bone. The procedure is generally painless. A temporary tooth may be placed the same day (immediate loading) in selected cases.

phase3.title: Phase 3: Osseointegration
phase3.text: For 3 to 6 months, bone integrates with the implant. This period is crucial for long-term success.

phase4.title: Phase 4: Definitive crown placement
phase4.text: After healing, the abutment and definitive crown are placed, custom-made to perfectly match your natural teeth.

implantes.recoveryText: Initial recovery lasts a few days to a week. During this period:

recovery.1: There may be some swelling and mild discomfort
recovery.3: Avoid hard foods in the operated area

implantes.successText: Dental implants have a success rate over 95% when placed by experienced professionals and with proper care. With regular maintenance, they can last a lifetime.
implantes.costText: Cost varies depending on the number of implants, crown type and additional procedures needed (such as bone grafting). We offer financing options to make treatment affordable.

finalCta.title: Want to recover your smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule a free evaluation to see if dental implants are the ideal solution for you.

estetica.title: Everything about teeth whitening
estetica.description: Learn about the different types of teeth whitening and which is most suitable for you. Complete guide on dental aesthetics.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want a whiter smile? Schedule an evaluation to discover the best type of whitening for you.

estetica.lead: Teeth whitening is one of the most sought-after aesthetic procedures in dental clinics. A whiter smile can significantly increase self-confidence and improve overall facial appearance.

takeaways.title: Key Points
takeaways.one: Professional whitening is safe and effective
takeaways.two: Results can last from 1 to 3 years

estetica.causesText: Teeth can darken for various reasons over time. Understanding the causes helps prevent and choose the most appropriate treatment.

food.title: Food and drinks
food.text: Coffee, tea, red wine and soft drinks with colorings

tobacco.title: Tobacco
tobacco.text: Smoking is one of the main causes of tooth stains

age.title: Age
age.text: Enamel wears naturally, revealing more yellowish dentin

medication.title: Medications
medication.text: Certain antibiotics and treatments can cause discoloration

office.title: 1. In-office whitening
office.text: Performed by the dentist, uses products with higher concentration of whitening agents, providing visible results in a single session. It's the fastest and most effective method.

home.title: 2. Supervised home whitening
home.text: The dentist makes personalized trays and provides whitening gel for home use. It's a more economical and comfortable option, although results take longer to appear.
home.application: Application: A few hours a day or overnight

combined.title: 3. Combined whitening
combined.text: Combines an in-office session with home maintenance treatment, offering the best of both methods: fast and lasting results.

estetica.safetyText: Yes, when performed or supervised by a qualified dentist. Products used in clinics are safe and tested. There may be some temporary sensitivity, which disappears after treatment.

aftercare.1: Avoid intensely colored foods and drinks in the first 48 hours
aftercare.2: Don't smoke during the treatment period
aftercare.4: Make regular visits to the dentist for maintenance

estetica.durationText: Results can last from 1 to 3 years, depending on eating habits, oral hygiene and lifestyle. Periodic maintenance treatments help prolong the effect.

faq.a1: When performed by a professional and with proper indication, whitening is safe. There may be temporary sensitivity, but it shouldn't cause enamel damage.
faq.a2: Whitening gel acts on natural teeth. Restorations don't change color, so it may be necessary to replace some to harmonize the result.
faq.q3: What to do if I have sensitivity?
faq.a3: It's common to have some sensitivity during or after treatment. The dentist can recommend desensitizing gel and adjust concentration/duration.

finalCta.title: Want a whiter smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule an evaluation to discover the best type of whitening for you.

odontopediatria.title: When to take children to the dentist?
odontopediatria.description: Know the ideal age for the first consultation and how to prepare the little ones for a positive experience at the dentist.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Our team is prepared to receive the little ones with all care and attention.

odontopediatria.lead: Children's oral health is fundamental for their development. Many parents wonder when they should take their children to the dentist for the first time and how to make this experience positive.
odontopediatria.imageAlt: Child at the dentist with parents
odontopediatria.idealAgeTitle: What's the ideal age for the first consultation?
odontopediatria.idealAgeText: The first visit to the dentist should occur when the first tooth erupts or, at the latest, by the child's first birthday. This initial consultation is essential to:

idealAge.3: Guide parents on infant oral hygiene
idealAge.4: Create a positive relationship between child and dentist

odontopediatria.preparationTitle: How to prepare the child for the consultation?

2.title: Read books:
2.text: There are children's stories about dentist visits

3.title: Play dentist:
3.text: Simulate a consultation at home with dolls

4.title: Choose the right time:
4.text: Prefer times when the child is rested

during.2: Let the dentist communicate directly with the child
during.3: Avoid making promises of exaggerated rewards
during.4: Praise the child's behavior after the consultation

bottle.title: Bottle cavities
bottle.text: Occur when the child falls asleep with a bottle of milk or juice in their mouth. To prevent, clean teeth after each feeding and avoid sugary drinks in the bottle.

thumb.title: Thumb sucking
thumb.text: It's natural in the first years, but should be discouraged after age 4 to avoid changes in tooth positioning and dental arch development.

trauma.title: Dental trauma
trauma.text: Falls and accidents are common in childhood. In case of dental trauma, seek a dentist immediately, even if there seem to be no visible damage.

0to2.title: 0-2 years
0to2.text: Clean gums with damp gauze. When first teeth appear, use a baby brush with water.

2to6.title: 2-6 years
2to6.text: Use fluoride toothpaste (pea-sized amount). Parents should supervise and help with brushing.

6plus.title: 6+ years
6plus.text: Child can brush alone, but parents should check. Introduce flossing when teeth start touching.

odontopediatria.frequencyTitle: How often to go to the dentist?
odontopediatria.frequencyText: After the first consultation, we recommend visiting the dentist every 6 months for routine check-ups. This frequency allows detecting and treating problems early, when they're easier to resolve.

finalCta.title: Is it time for your child's first consultation?
finalCta.text: Our team is prepared to receive the little ones with all care and attention.

faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our services
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our services.

hours.a: We're open Monday to Friday from 9am to 7pm, and Saturdays from 9am to 1pm. We close on Sundays and holidays.

appointment.q: How can I book an appointment?
appointment.a: You can book through our website by clicking 'Book Appointment', calling our phone number, or sending a WhatsApp message. We can usually schedule appointments within 48 hours.

payments.q: What payment methods do you accept?
payments.a: We accept cash, ATM, credit/debit cards (Visa, Mastercard), MB Way and bank transfer. We also offer payment facilities for more extensive treatments.

insurance.q: Do you work with health insurance?
insurance.a: Yes, we work with the main insurers in Portugal. Please contact us with your insurance details to confirm coverage and procedures.

routine_duration.q: How long does a routine consultation take?
routine_duration.a: A routine consultation (check-up and cleaning) generally takes between 45 to 60 minutes. For the first consultation, we recommend reserving about 90 minutes to include complete evaluation and planning.

pain.a: We use modern anesthesia and sedation techniques to ensure maximum comfort. Most of our patients report little or no discomfort during procedures. We prioritize your well-being in all treatments.

kids_first_visit.q: At what age should I bring my child to the dentist?
kids_first_visit.a: We recommend the first visit to the dentist right after the first tooth appears, or at the latest by the first year of age. Early consultations help establish good oral health habits and prevent future problems.

implant_duration.q: How long does implant treatment take?
implant_duration.a: The complete process generally takes between 3 to 6 months, depending on the case. This includes implant placement, healing period (osseointegration) and definitive crown placement. In some cases, we can offer immediate loading solutions.

whitening.a: Yes, professional teeth whitening is completely safe when performed by qualified professionals. We use approved products and techniques that protect enamel and gums, providing lasting and safe results.

booking.q: Do I need to pay in advance to book?
booking.a: No advance payment is required for routine consultations. For more complex treatments that require specific preparation, a deposit may be requested. We'll always inform you in advance if this is the case.

cta.text: Didn't find the answer you were looking for?

contact.title: Come
contact.description: We're located in Quinta do Conde, with easy access and nearby parking. Get in touch with us.

cta.title: Book Your Appointment Today!
cta.description: Don't wait any longer to care for your smile. Our team is ready to receive you.
